etymology.description: 好(好) (hǎo, "good") + 了(了) (le, "particle indicating change or completion") combines to mean 'alright then' or 'okay' indicating agreement or the completion of an action or change in state.
etymology.interpretation: In this expression, 好(好) (hǎo, "good") expresses a positive or satisfactory state, while 了(了) (le, "particle indicating change or completion") signifies that something has changed or been completed. Together, it conveys a sense of readiness or agreement, akin to saying 'alright then' in English.

examples.chinese: 我们准备好了吗(我們準備好了嗎)，好了(好了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zhǔnbèi hǎo le ma, hǎo le.

examples.chinese: 天色已晚(天色已晚)，好了(好了)。
